text:
Hi Community,
Testing something here and not sure fully know what I maybe missing. Essentially trying to link HubSpot to "Random Invoicing System" The quotes would be created in HS and sent but needs to map to "Random Invoicing System" what exactly do I need from the random system in order for this to work? Thinking about using the CRM extension endpoint. Here is a screenshot of the logic....(I don't think there is an Quotes API from HubSpot but essentially it would be to link the other aspects)
<@UEZJ74UN8> check for products api, i feel products/quotes you can manage in that way
thanks <@UCH1L597V> I am kind new to this but wondering are you saying that the products api will work in place of the quotes api?
What would I use to pass the company id, deal id, deal amount from HubSpot? Is the CRM Extension API best for that?

<@UEZJ74UN8> what i am recommending is to create your quotes as `products` on HubSpot, and then you can create a deal associated those products and `line items` <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/products/create-product>

<@UCH1L597V> that's a great suggestion but in this case we can only use quotes and can't use products as a quote :disappointed: is there any other way to pretty much map when a quote is sent from HubSpot to another platform the information related to that quote (company id, deal amount,date)
yes in the deal you can store that - you can assign contact, company, date, amount and other meta information

I see so from the HubSpot end:
Things needed:
1) Deal API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/deals_overview>
2) Companies API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/companies/companies-overview>

From the "random invoice system"
-They need to have an open API to would allow for the mapping of HS properties to their system?
-How else can it map the two fields so when properties in HubSpot get updated it also updates the "random invoice system"
Yes that part you have to manage, so you should have an script to handle the mapping of both systems
Is there anything on the "random invoicing system" that can limit this or it needs to have for this to be created?
can you dm me with the link of randon invoicing system please?
Anyone else getting some weird HS errors this morning?
One of our devs got that too, seems like the same list in the same order
I've same errors
I am told a fix is being rolled out.
Is email testing down for everyone, or did I just hit a limit?

Thank you, Alex!
Let me check, workable or not that above link. I might reach out you later if i would need any more help.

is it normal for a purchased marketplace template / module that includes linked stylesheets or javascript files to retain the link to where they were downloaded from?
I'd have assumed that downloading the template / module would have placed any files into appropriate folders whether they were in the design manager or in the file manager.

*Are there any settings in HubSpot which add the social profile data to a site for search engines?*
<https://developers.google.com/search/docs/data-types/social-profile>
Can obviously manually code it in, but don’t want to do that if HubSpot automatically handles this)
I think it depends on the template/module’s creator and how they built them. HS only allows “good reputation” cdns and their own HubSpot CDN for external assets
like the file manager reference links back to `https://<developer_root>/hubfs/hs_marketplace_assets/modules/<module_name>/<css_file>.css`
anyone know?
nothing that adds the `itemscope` that I know
I've found structured data to be lacking on some of the HS CMS
Might end up submitting to the code gallery some HubL markup for adding in this info
I see a possible opportunity to make it easier to do some of that stuff in <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> :wink: wouldn’t be hard to pull the social account data from HS automatically

Yea shouldn't be too hard, you can alway loop through to social profiles in site settings or if its for a person you can do it through the blog author info (but we would need more additional author bio fields... like custom fields... cough cough)
yea
<@U7SL518D6> have you found any issues with the resize image hubl not working the last few days?
I haven’t noticed it not working
even if it stopped working I’d report the issue rather than reverting to not use it. Because then it’s a HubSpot problem.
100% I just noticed it in 1 client yesterday and a second one today so now I'm checking to make sure it's not just me
that would be a js job im afraid
unless it was a coded template
why couldn’t you do it in the head of a drag n drop?

You could do it in the head or in a custom module that is added to the body (naturally depending on what you need to pull in).
>>>JavaScript notation embedded in a <script> tag in the page head or body. The markup is not interleaved with the user-visible text, which makes nested data items easier to express, such as the Country of a PostalAddress of a MusicVenue of an Event. Also, Google can read JSON-LD data when it is dynamically injected into the page's contents, such as by JavaScript code or embedded widgets in your content management system.
